entries.speaker: SPEAKER_01
entries.transcript: Joe, have a seat.  Finally.  Sounds like you're feeling a bit frustrated.

entries.speaker: SPEAKER_01
entries.transcript: So it sounds like you didn't get the straight answer you were looking for.

entries.speaker: SPEAKER_01
entries.transcript: Well, Joe, it sounds to me like you waited a lot longer than you had expected to.  Then you didn't get the information or respect you'd hoped for from Jessica, my assistant.

entries.speaker: SPEAKER_01
entries.transcript: And now you're pretty irritated using time efficiently is very important to you especially  in the middle of a busy work day right?

entries.speaker: SPEAKER_01
entries.transcript: And I imagine you might be a little bit worried about your son, too.  I know how important his safety is to you.  Is this partly what's going on here?

entries.speaker: SPEAKER_01
entries.transcript: pretty well shot. So the having some predictability would have been nice.

entries.speaker: SPEAKER_01
entries.transcript: Well, you know, Joe, predictability is something that I value as well, and using time efficiently  is something that's really important to me.  I really want to be able to give you immediate attention, and so when I hear that you are  waiting around for such a long period of time without any explanation as to why that's happening,  I feel a bit of disappointment and regret.

entries.speaker: SPEAKER_01
entries.transcript: As it turns out, I was just across the street at the hospital attending to  a delivery for a patient of mine. They were having an unexpected crunch in  laboring and delivery area and taking care of that patient and her baby  is very important to me too.

entries.speaker: SPEAKER_01
entries.transcript: I honestly had no idea how long I would be, and I made the choice to take the time and go over there.

entries.speaker: SPEAKER_01
entries.transcript: Well, you know Joe, it sounds like you're maybe feeling a little bit of regret now,  thinking about how you spoke to Jessica. It's okay to feel that way. And it's also okay to feel  upset when you weren't getting the predictability and the information you'd been hoping for.

entries.speaker: SPEAKER_01
entries.transcript: I do my very best to consider everyone's needs, Joe. Yours included.

entries.speaker: SPEAKER_01
entries.transcript: I agree that Jessica would appreciate it if you would acknowledge her own needs in the  situation too.  For all she was doing her best to honor my patient's privacy and my own flexibility.

entries.speaker: SPEAKER_01
entries.transcript: So, uh, what did you need refilled?  Ah.  Yes.  Uh-huh.  Okay.
